DataElement.preferredName: Image Service-Object Pair Class Unique Identifier ISO21090.II.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify an grouping of an imaging event. [Manually-curated]_Identifier that uniquely identifies a thing or object.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Image Service-Object Pair Class Unique Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify an grouping of an imaging event. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: The information object and the service class are the two fundamental components of DICOM. Information objects define the core contents of medical imaging, and service classes define what to do with those contents. The service classes and information objects are combined to form the functional units of DICOM. This combination is called a service-object pair.:A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.:The single one of its kind.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: The information object and the service class are the two fundamental components of DICOM. Information objects define the core contents of medical imaging, and service classes define what to do with those contents. The service classes and information objects are combined to form the functional units of DICOM. This combination is called a service-object pair.
A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.
The single one of its kind.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
